content: Thunderbird is not a wordpress plugin. What are you trying to do?
creator: davidsk

content:
re :Comcast added email settings security with a box to check to allow third party to access.

Have you selected that checkbox to allow third party access ? If no, then select it - at least logon to the webmail account via a browser and check it is selected otherwise Xfinity will block you.

Have you reset a new password in comcast/Xfinity webmail account ? If yes, have you accessed the stored password in Thunderbird and updated it for both the imap and the smtp ? If no, then get new password saved:

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Password section
  • click on 'Saved Passwords'
  • Click on 'Show Passwords'
  • For both incoming imap line and outgoing smtp line -
  • right clickon line and select 'Edit Password'

When completed - restart Thunderbird.

If still a problem then post an image of the error message.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
IMAP is a protocol with clear specifications on how it works. And so using imap literally means software implementing it will have the same message on the server that are presented to the local computer. End of story. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/new/thunderbird

To accomplish an approximation of what you want your only choice is to copy the messages you want to keep to Local Folders before deleting from the imap server.
creator: wsmwk

content: Non funziona la mail confraternitemrgt@libero.it Quando mando una mail esce la scritta: Invio del messaggio non riuscito. Non è stato possibile inviare il messaggio perché la connessione al server in uscita (SMTP) imap non è riuscita. Il server potrebbe non essere disponibile o rifiutare le connessioni in uscita (SMTP). Verificare che le impostazioni del server in uscita (SMTP) siano corrette e riprovare. Quando tento di scaricare le mails esce la scritta connessione al server imap non riuscita
creator: d.giov

content:
The image shows the 'pin' icon has been selected. This means you set up a filter on perhaps another folder or even the one you are viewing and then selected the 'pin' to make sure that filter got applied to everything.

Uncheck the 'pin' icon to remove any pre-selected filters.

On the 'Menu bar' toolbar (not via the Menu app icon) View > Threads > select 'All' If 'unread' is selected click on it to remove the filter.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: You can copy the messages from one account to another. Is that the question? If POP accounts, you can Edit>select all and right-click and select 'copy to'.. If IMAP, it's trickier, as you have the network interaction to consider. In that case, I suggest creating a filter to do the copy. Do not use MOVE, as if problems surface, you may lose messages.
creator: davidsk

content: Disattiva la vista per discussioni -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/thunderbird-messaggi-raggruppati-discussione
creator: @next

content:
In Menu > Impostazioni account > Impostazioni server togli la spunta da [ ] Controlla nuovi messaggi all'avvio [ ] Controlla nuovi messaggi ogni __ minuti

Questo evita la consultazione in automatico. Se per fai click manualmente sul tasto per scaricare la posta, vengono controllati tutti gli account.

In alternativa sposta i messaggi sotto Cartelle locali (creando le opportune sottocartelle) e poi elimina l'account.
creator: @next

content: Is this a self-hosted email account? The MX record is on the server and is part of the email routing process and is normally well-maintained when securing an account with a major emaip provider. The message indicates you are attempting to send from one IP address, yet the associated MX record disagrees. (A more technical person could give a more thorough response, but this is the gist of it.) I think you may need to pursue this with your email provider.
creator: davidsk

content: The fact that you have multiple mobilecharters indicates there has been corruption in the past, possibly during updates. Those multiple account profiles are what is causing the issue and the challenge is in locating which is the one that Thunderbird is using. I suggest looking at 'account settings' to see which folder is the active account. Once that is confirmed, I suggest renaming to eliminate the added number, but I would not delete anything until you confirm that all is okay.
creator: davidsk

content: Compacting folders will also help.
creator: davidsk

content:
I deleted SentMail(70gb) using WIN explorer. Nothing else had worked to delete before. Closed and reopened Thunderbird and folder regenerated with the couple messages that I had moved to it. The 70gb was removed from my C:\ drive.

So happy as a lark. "I hate IMAP"
